definition: to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite

to gather/to collect/collected works/classifier for sections of a TV series etc: episode

sentences.english: How long would it take to assemble a team for a project like this?
sentences.chinese: 为这样一个计划调集一个小组的人需要多长时间？

sentences.english: Chapter Two, The study on the cultural background and the standard to select poem .
sentences.chinese: 第二章，《才调集》产生的文化背景与选诗标准。

sentences.english: Coordinate the movement and consignment of USG relief commodities.
sentences.chinese: 协调美国政府援助物资的调集和交付。

sentences.english: They assembled a tremendous force to face the attack.
sentences.chinese: 他们调集了巨大的兵力来对付这场进攻。

sentences.english: So the year following Lysias gathered together threescore thousand chosen men, and five thousand horsemen, that he might subdue them.
sentences.chinese: 次年，他调集六万精兵，五千骑兵，来攻打犹太人。

sentences.english: And they were struck with great fear, because they heard that the king had given him authority to gather together an army.
sentences.chinese: 堡垒里的人一听王给了他调集军队的权柄，都很害怕。

sentences.english: Dutch colonial army quickly mobilized a large number of military defense fairways .
sentences.chinese: 荷兰殖民军急忙调集大批军队防守航道。

sentences.english: Team see the time is ripe, immediately start mobilizing police officer.
sentences.chinese: 专案组见时机成熟，马上调集警力展开围捕行动。
